intro: Calyptranthes estoraquensis, commonly known as Estoraquense Calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the cloud forests of Ecuador, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a leathery texture, while its bark is smooth and reddish-brown. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted geographic distribution.
